content: What 19th-century French artist is best known for his paintings of ballet dancers, such as "The Dance Class" and "L'Étoile"?

The 19th-century French artist best known for his paintings of ballet dancers, such as "The Dance Class" and "L'Étoile," is Edgar Degas. Degas was a prominent figure in the Impressionist movement, although he preferred to be called a Realist. He was particularly drawn to the world of dance and often depicted the behind-the-scenes moments of ballet rehearsals and performances, capturing the grace and discipline of the dancers. His works are celebrated for their composition, use of color, and the way they convey movement and atmosphere.
